channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Vance was one of Pope Francis' last visitors
item.description: Vice President JD Vance, who met with the leader of the Catholic Church at the Vatican on Easter Sunday, was one of Pope Francis's last visitors.

item.title: The European Union Attempts to Extend Its Regulatory Tentacles
item.description: The EU has gone far beyond what was agreed to in Paris.

item.title: Congress Should Strip Tax Exemptions From All Woke Nonprofits, Not Just Harvard
item.description: Leftist non-profits should lose their tax-exempt status. And there’s a very easy way to do it: all of them have DEI departments.

item.title: Vance arrives in India for a 4-day visit that includes talks with Modi and personal engagements

item.title: The More Christian That America Is, The Better Off American Jews Will Be
item.description: If wokeism, Islamism, and global neoliberalism are to be decisively rejected, then Americans should support fortifying the church.

item.title: Trump Could Have a Strong Case to Revoke Harvard’s Tax-Exempt Status
item.description: Thanks to a 1983 opinion widely hailed by progressives at the time, the administration could be on solid ground.

item.title: When a Mom Needs Help, Does Anyone Show?
item.description: Fostering real-life charity is integrity.

item.title: The Breakfast Club Cast’s 40-Year Reunion Shows Why A Modern Remake Would Never Work
item.description: Maybe the cast could use a little more time in detention to think about what the film really means today.

item.title: America Rattles Denmark
item.description: A report from an allied capital in a strange time.

item.title: China Expels Missionaries, Treating Christianity As Existential Threat To Totalitarianism
item.description: China is actively forcing all religious activity to align with Chinese culture and communism, and ensuring loyalty to the CCP.

item.title: Steve Witkoff Is a Master of Confusion
